isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9200, 9300, 9400 Models Built After January 1, 1995 - ELECTRICAL TROUBLESHOOTING LIGHT SYSTEMS - OPERATION - HEADLIGHTS ON 9300 USA AND CANADA W/O DRL

svcproc.title: HEADLIGHTS ON 9300 USA AND CANADA W/O DRL
svcproc.para: The 9300 model trucks utilize a four headlight system, two on each side. The two upper lamps receive power in the low beam mode on circuit 53B with the power split up on 53C for the right lamp and 53D for the left lamp. The two upper lamps receive power in the high beam mode from circuit 52F, with power split up on 52E for the right lamp and 52D for the left lamp. The two lower lamps also receive power from circuit 52F in the high beam mode. The power is split up on 52K for the right lower light and 52J for the left lower light.
Circuits 52-GD, 52-GB and 52-GA provide the ground path for the left headlights to J7 cab ground. Circuits 52-GH, 52-GF, 52-GE, 52-GF, and 11-GF provide the ground path for the right headlights.
